findings.title: Unprotected function call can lead to unauthorized state changes
findings.description: The contract was using delegatecall() or call() which was accepting address controlled by a user. This can have devastating effects on the contract as a delegate call allows the contract to execute code belonging to other contracts but using it’s own storage.

findings.title: Possible reentrancy vulnerability in transferFrom function
findings.description: Reentrancy issue in the transferFrom function.

findings.title: A05.Lack of input validation in public functions
findings.description: The contract does not validate inputs in its public functions.

findings.title: Insecure use of block.timestamp
findings.description: The contract uses block.timestamp which can be manipulated by miners.

findings.title: Possible front-running vulnerability in addLiquidityETH function
A11.Lack of access control in setAutomatedMarketMakerPair function
findings.description: Lack of access control in setAutomatedMarketMakerPair function.
